name: Project Mindful Chaos
description:
This project is heavily inspired by titles like "Tetris" and "Moving Out". If you like my stuff, consider subscribing to my Youtube Channel or better yet, buy me a coffee so that I can spend more time making more stuff like this!

Story

With the rising cost of fuel and inflation. 

Travel costs are expensive. 

You play as a mover for a company. Be efficient at packing everything into a single container to avoid secondary trip.

Can you move it all in one trip?

How to play?
  • Move all the objects to the red shipping container.
  • Hold left mouse button to grab an object.
  • While grabbing an object, hold T and move the mouse to rotate the object.
  • While grabbing an object, press right mouse button to throw the object.
  • WASD to move.
  • C to crouch.
  • Z to prone.
  • Shift + WASD to sprint.
What to expect at current stage?
  • One level featuring a whitebox "training" level to learn the mechanics of the game.
  • My attempt to voice act American accent. Turn up the volume to hear it!
Known bugs
  • Texture glitch/missing when switching levels. - Current solution is just quit the game and start again.
  • A lag happen right before picking up objects.
Upcoming updates
  • Add furnitures into sandbox level and use as training.
  • Add sound effects + training narration.
  • Fix lag when first time looking at an pickup-able object.
  • Add 3 more levels
  • Tools to pack items
  • Scoreboard
